trans-unit.source: Configure an SFTP Destination
trans-unit.target: Configure an SFTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Configure an SFTP Destination
trans-unit.target: Configure an SFTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Lists the steps to create an SFTP Destination in <token>azure_2</token> <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: Lists the steps to create an SFTP Destination in <token>azure_2</token> <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: To successfully route messages to an SFTP Destination, the SFTP FileName must be added as a Route Action.
trans-unit.target: To successfully route messages to an SFTP Destination, the SFTP FileName must be added as a Route Action.

trans-unit.source: This FileName can either be a promoted property from the SFTP Source or it could be hardcoded as an expression.
trans-unit.target: This FileName can either be a promoted property from the SFTP Source or it could be hardcoded as an expression.

trans-unit.source: Add an SFTP Destination
trans-unit.target: Add an SFTP Destination

trans-unit.source: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Create a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Steps at <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.
trans-unit.target: Steps at <link xlink:href="03421690-817a-45a8-8492-c9cb98484102" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to Create a Message Flow Project</link>.

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.
trans-unit.target: For the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property, enter your <token>af_integration</token> URL.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>SFTP </embeddedLabel> component under <ui>Route Destinations</ui> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>SFTP </embeddedLabel> component under <ui>Route Destinations</ui> to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the component and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique and descriptive name of the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique and descriptive name of the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component.

trans-unit.source: Folder Path
trans-unit.target: Folder Path

trans-unit.source: Specify the folder on the SFTP server to put the messages.
trans-unit.target: Specify the folder on the SFTP server to put the messages.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to put all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso SFTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to put all XML messages in the CustomerFiles\Contoso SFTP folder, enter <ui>CustomerFiles\Contoso</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the username password that can put files on the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username password that can put files on the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Server Address
trans-unit.target: Server Address

trans-unit.source: Enter the SFTP server name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SFTP server name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Server Port
trans-unit.target: Server Port

trans-unit.source: Enter the SFTP server port.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SFTP server port.

trans-unit.source: Default is 22.
trans-unit.target: Default is 22.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: Enter the username that can put files on the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter the username that can put files on the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>
trans-unit.target: From the File menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Server Authentication</legacyBold>: The SFTP Source and SFTP Destination trust all server certificates.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Server Authentication</legacyBold>: The SFTP Source and SFTP Destination trust all server certificates.

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Client Authentication</legacyBold>: Enter a username and password that can get/put files on the SFTP computer folder.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Client Authentication</legacyBold>: Enter a username and password that can get/put files on the SFTP computer folder.

trans-unit.source: This is exactly the same as logging into an FTP server.
trans-unit.target: This is exactly the same as logging into an FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Additional
trans-unit.target: Additional

trans-unit.source: SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) is a common protocol used to securely transfer files between two external partners.
trans-unit.target: SSH File Transfer Protocol (SFTP) is a common protocol used to securely transfer files between two external partners.

trans-unit.source: SFTP has become one the preferred methods to transfer files.
trans-unit.target: SFTP has become one the preferred methods to transfer files.

trans-unit.source: <token>af_integration</token> includes SFTP functionality that enables you to send messages to an SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: <token>af_integration</token> includes SFTP functionality that enables you to send messages to an SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists the steps to use an SFTP server as a message destination in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists the steps to use an SFTP server as a message destination in a <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Use this destination to push a message to a folder on an SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Use this destination to push a message to a folder on an SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component can be used as the destination to an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component can be used as the destination to an <token>one-way</token> or a <token>passthru</token>.

trans-unit.source: An <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> cannot be used a destination for <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: An <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> cannot be used a destination for <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="81b3d264-667e-4fe0-bbdd-14293cedd9da" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Bridges</link> provides details on how to configure these <token>bridge</token>s.

trans-unit.source: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox, and connect the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: After you have added a bridge and the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> component to the design area, select <ui>Connector</ui> from the Toolbox, and connect the <embeddedLabel>SFTP Destination</embeddedLabel> to the <token>bridge</token>.
